meanings.definition: The establishment of a plant or animal in a new habitat.
meanings.sent1: The ecesis of the rabbit in the forest was a sign of nature's balance.
meanings.sent2: The ecesis of the seedlings in the garden brought new life to the soil.
meanings.sent3: The ecesis of the penguin in the desert would make for a funny cartoon.
meanings.sent4: The ecesis of ideas in her mind bloomed like flowers in spring.
meanings.sent5: The ecesis of the butterfly in the city was a colorful surprise.

meanings.definition: The process of adapting to a new environment.
meanings.sent1: The ecesis of the fish to the colder water took time but was successful.
meanings.sent2: Her ecesis to the fast-paced city life was challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: The ecesis of the cat to wearing a hat was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His ecesis to the role of a leader was like a caterpillar turning into a butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The ecesis of the plant to the shade resulted in beautiful, lush leaves.

meanings.definition: The successful establishment of a species in a new area.
meanings.sent1: The ecesis of the invasive species caused harm to the local ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The ecesis of the rare bird species in the park was a cause for celebration.
meanings.sent3: The ecesis of the monkeys in the library would be quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The ecesis of love in their hearts spread like wildfire in the community.
meanings.sent5: The ecesis of the new technology in the market changed the industry forever.
